subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Keyboard Driver Experimental Version!
msgSnippet: ... downloaded the program, installed it...  worked around it ... [snip] Very well. I m at school now but I ll try to give you some directions. First you
messageBody:
--- geoflyfisher <geoflyfisher@...> wrote: > OK... I
downloaded the program, installed it... worked around it
> for
> at least 5 minutes... Very impatient I am!
>
> Could you please give us some step by step directions? I know I
> need
> them. I did try to read the .kmn file with a text processor but
> did
> not see anything in the file.
>
> Help.....
>
> Rick
[snip]

Very well. I'm at school now but I'll try to give you some
directions.

First you install the program. Keep the directory in mind. Then put
the keyboard driver and bitmaps in the same folder as the program.
Start the program. Right-click/double click gives a menu. Go to
options. Unload all drivers, and then load my driver file. Close the
options window, press 'hide' or something like that, open a word
processor, choose the Jerome font, click the NO QS button, it will
now read QS. Then you can type in NewRomaji. Information about
Newromaji can be found at
http://victorian.fortunecity.com/vangogh/555/Spell/new_romaji.html

I have made two major changes to Newromaji: SH is now x, UU is u and
U is uu in my driver. This is in order to save time typing.

If you look in the driver file, you will see stuff like:

'a' + 'a' > 'y'

meaning if someone types 'aa' it is automatically converted to the
Jerome character y. You can easily figure out the other sounds this
way. Print it out or something. AU is as in sOUr, OU is as in gO.

But it very likely there will be some errors in there. It's not
really too hard to fix them though. Give it a try. The help file
provided with Keyman will also provide the required information.

Ewout
